metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13791 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: hw/pci/pci.c in QEMU 4.2.0 allows guest OS users to trigger an out-of-bounds access by providing an address near the end of the PCI configuration space.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Ren Ding, Hanqing Zhao, Yi Ren

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2022-06-09, the proposed fix has not been commited while the CVE description mentions hw/pci/pci.c, that is incorrect, the CVE is assigned to the hw/display/ati.c issue, the patch to hw/pci/pci.c is just a defense in depth fix.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
